subject: [Bad] Mint.com makes no warranties as to disclosure of information
text:
"INTUIT MAKES NO WARRANTIES OR REPRESENTATIONS OF ANY KIND, EXPRESS, STATUTORY OR IMPLIED AS TO: [...] ANY DISCLOSURE OF INFORMATION TO THIRD PARTIES"
https://github.com/tosdr/tosback2/blob/265e49bf24a91076495ce1fddf279c4638421a66/crawl/mint.com/Terms%20of%20Use.txt#L89

isn't that a bit strange? from the context, in a list with things like saying the app may not work if you don't have internet connectivity, it rather stands out, i wonder why the felt the need to include this.

it is definitely strange that i would hand over all my sensitive financial data to a company that expressly warns that they may leave it in the wrong place, either accidentally or because they feel like it.
